title: Despite Its Barrage of Missiles, Russia Still Loses Ground in Ukraine
description: “They use their expensive rockets for nothing, just to frighten people,” a member of Ukraine’s Parliament said of Russian attacks on the country’s cities and infrastructure.

title: Despite Its Barrage of Missiles, Russia Still Loses Ground in Ukraine
description: “They use their expensive rockets for nothing, just to frighten people,” a member of Ukraine’s Parliament said of Russian attacks on the country’s cities and infrastructure.

title: Far from home, Ukrainians once again take to the streets to protest Russia’s invasion.
Under Fire, New U.K. Leader Retreats on Economic Strategy
description: Fighting for her political survival, Prime Minister Liz Truss fired her top ally and reversed course on tax-cutting plans, trying to shore up financial markets and her poll ratings.

title: 20 Nations at High Risk From Global Warming Might Halt Debt Payments
description: The countries want their collective $685 billion in debts forgiven so the money can be invested in climate projects.

title: How the fallout from Putin’s war doomed a farming village in Germany.
Lessons From Liz Truss’s Handling of U.K. Inflation
description: The sharp policy U-turn by Liz Truss, Britain’s prime minister, reveals the perils of taking the wrong path in the fight against scalding inflation.

title: For Truss and the Tories, a ‘Fairy Tale’ Unravels
description: Having abandoned her signature economic plan, it remains unclear whether the British prime minister or her party can reclaim a mandate.

title: As the Bank of England’s Intervention Ends, Unease Returns to the Bond Markets
description: A two-and-a-half-week program of bond buying came to a close on Friday, leaving investors nervous about what will happen when markets reopen on Monday.

title: Britain is facing economic headaches, some new and some entrenched.
Biden’s ‘Made in America’ Policies Anger Key Allies
description: The president’s plans to bolster America’s electric vehicle and battery production have opened a rift in relationships in Asia and Europe.

title: U.K. government hasn’t seen this level of turnover in a long, long time.
description: The recent turmoil in Britain’s government, with its rapid turnover of finance ministers, is highly unusual.

title: Report Criticizes C.I.A.’s Initial Handling of Havana Syndrome Cases
description: An inspector general report sent to Congress this week finds fault with the intelligence agency’s Office of Medical Services.

title: Unrest Grows in West Bank in Deadliest Year Since 2015
description: Israeli security forces shot dead two Palestinians on Friday during a raid in the northern West Bank, after a week of intensifying unrest and shootings.

title: How Security Forces Cracked Down in Southeastern Iran
description: A New York Times analysis of witness testimony and videos reveals a bloody scene that unfolded last month in Zahedan during Friday Prayer, with mats as stretchers and bodies piled in cars.

title: Dutch Princess ‘Can’t Really Go Outside’ After Threats
description: She started college in Amsterdam last month, but Princess Amalia is back living in a palace in The Hague because of concerns that she might be attacked or abducted.

title: Who Is Jeremy Hunt, New U.K. Chancellor?
description: His selection for the post appeared intended to restore calm to financial markets.

title: Climate Protesters Throw Soup Over van Gogh’s ‘Sunflowers’
description: Two activists attacked the famous painting at the National Gallery, in London.

title: Live Updates: U.K. Government Reverses Course on Fiscal Plan That Rattled Markets
description: Prime Minister Liz Truss vowed to raise the country’s corporate tax rate, reversing a plan that had been outlined in a set of measures that her government proposed last month. She also fired Kwasi Kwarteng, her finance minister.

title: Turkey Allows Jail Terms for What It Deems ‘Fake News’
description: Rights advocates fear the government could use newly passed legislation to restrict speech and target critics in the run-up to crucial elections in June.

title: Can Russia Keep Firing Missiles at Cities? And What Defenses Does Ukraine Need?
description: Efforts to help Ukraine shield its cities may depend on the scarcity of both Russian missiles and Western air defense systems.

title: Kwasi Kwarteng Is Reportedly Ousted as U.K. Finance Minister
description: Kwasi Kwarteng, the chancellor of the Exchequer, was under pressure to reverse his fiscal plan after it rattled markets and prompted an open backlash among politicians.

title: Elon Musk Says SpaceX Can’t Fund Internet Service in Ukraine ‘Indefinitely’
description: Starlink terminals have been critical in allowing the Ukrainian military to coordinate on the battlefield, including in recent offensives.

title: Fifteen nations join European air-defense network spurred by Russia’s missile strikes in Ukraine.
Russia Calls for Civilians to Evacuate From Kherson Amid Ukraine’s Advances
description: The first civilians leaving the occupied region were expected to arrive in Russia on Friday, according to Russian news media reports. It was unclear how many people were going.

title: China’s Internet Censors Race to Quell Beijing Protest Chatter
description: Some search terms were banned, WeChat accounts suspended and songs removed to stop discussion of a rare public protest denouncing Xi Jinping.

title: Herschel Walker’s Polling Dip
description: How the Senate race in Georgia is shaking out.

title: French Refineries Strike May Presage a Winter of Discontent for Europe
description: Bitten by inflation, workers are demanding a greater share of the surging profits of energy giants. It’s the kind of unrest leaders fear as they struggle to keep a united front against Russia.

title: Kwasi Kwarteng, Top U.K. Finance Official, Cuts U.S. Trip Short
description: Kwasi Kwarteng, the chancellor of the Exchequer, is under pressure to reverse his fiscal plan after it rattled markets and prompted an open backlash among politicians.

title: Father Joe, Bangkok’s Priest to the Poor, Thrives Among Fellow Outcasts
description: For 50 years, the Rev. Joseph Maier has lived in one of the poorest parts of the Thai capital, ministering to Catholics, Buddhists and Muslims alike, and never finding favor with the church hierarchy.

title: Beyond Borders: A Deep Dive Into the Nomadic Way of Life
description: Anthony Sattin, the author of a new book on nomadic groups, discusses how contemporary travelers and digital nomads can learn a few things from traditional cultures.

title: Western nations rush defensive systems to Ukraine to counter Russian missiles.
In Bucha, a Kyiv suburb haunted by war, a family says goodbye to a fallen soldier.
The Future of Australian Children’s TV
description: It might make more economic sense for all English-language programming to be made in Los Angeles, but that would come at a different cost.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: A fourth day of Russian bombardment.

title: Xi Jinping, China’s Leader, Embodies His Authoritarian Era
description: Xi Jinping was first cast as a firm but genial leader with a common touch. Approaching a second decade in power, he looms over China like a stern Communist monarch.
